title: Proportions: Chocolate Manufacturing
question_text:
A certain chocolate bar is advertised as having a weight of $1\text{ ounce}$.
To minimize the number of consumer complaints about underweight candy bars, the candy company sets its machines to produce chocolate bars whose weights are normally distributed with $\mu = 1.1\text{ ounces}$ and $\sigma = 0.08\text{ ounces}$.
What proportion of chocolate bars will weigh $1\text{ ounce}$ or more?
